page.title: 19LIVESTOCK FARMING
page.content: The area is suited to sheep farming.The two main types of sheep are the Cheviot and Border Leicester.These sheep are very hardy and can spend the winter out on the hills.The tup is put to the ewe around November and the ewes lamb late March/ early April.The sheep are fed on the farms own hay,turnips and concentrates.The local mart is at Wooler(10 miles away). There are nowhere near as many cattle kept and few if any of the local farms keep milking cows though several have old milking parlours in their buildings.Most of the cattle are kept as sucklers and are sold for meat.Calves are born in the early winter. New large sheds now mean that young animals can be kept indoors during the first few days of life.
